availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob B. Ehrich (clerk of Louisville Police Department)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, police department clerk. Kentucky native. Police department clerk under James Kirkpatrick, Col. William R. Ray, and Col. Henry Dent in Louisville in c1860s. Assistant Chief of Police in Louisville in c1860s. Moved to St. Louis, Missouri, in 1870.

ab.bibl:
“Died in St. Louis: Tribute to Jacob B. Ehrich, an Old Time Citizen of Louisville,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), July 18, 1897, p. A8.
Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 81.
